definition: a mistake/an oversight/an error of judgment
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to make an error of judgment/to be taken in

sentences.english: I'm terribly sorry. I took the salt for sugar.
sentences.chinese: 真对不起了，我看走眼了，我把食盐当成白糖了。

definition: to make an error of judgment/to be taken in
to know what's what
blurred vision of an old person (idiom)
eyesight/strength of vision/the ability to make discerning judgments
to misinterpret what one sees or reads/to misjudge (sb)/to mistake (sb for sb else)/to misread (a document)
(idiom) blind as a bat (figuratively)/unaware of who (or what) one is dealing with/to fail to recognize what sb a bit more perceptive would
to have real skill/to know one's stuff
venomous glance/hostile gaze/sharp-eyed
to miscalculate/miscalculation
to meet with unexpected failure (idiom)/to fail miserably (where failure was not expected)
the sage presents as an ordinary person (idiom)
connoisseur/expert/veteran
dotard
to blame sb wrongly
cunning/crafty/wily old fox
you can't judge a person by appearance (idiom)/you can't judge a book by its cover/often in combination 人不可貌相，海水不可斗量[ren2 bu4 ke3 mao4 xiang4 , hai3 shui3 bu4 ke3 dou3 liang2]
